Package player

Class Player

java.lang.Object
player.Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class; Represents a player in the chess game. The Player class contains a static int playerCount that stores the number of existing Player object. Every time a Player object is constructed, the player count increments by one, and is automatically assigned to the index of the Player object. Based on the index of the player, each Player object is assigned to a Color, which is default Color.YELLOW for the first player (of index 0), and Color.BLUE for the second player (of index 1). Each Player object also contains a Set<Piece>, in which Piece objects are initialized by calling initializePieces.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Constructs a new Player object; The index of which is based on the number of existing players. Based on the index, assign a Color to the Player, which is default Color.YELLOW for the first Player (of index 0), and Color.BLUE for the second Player (of index 1).

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns the Color object of the Player. The color returned is default Color.YELLOW for the first Player (of index 0), and Color.BLUE for the second Player (of index 1).
      Returns:
      the Color object of the Player, Color.YELLOW for Player of index 0, Color.BLUE for Player of index 1

    • initializePieces

      public void initializePieces(int offsetX, int offsetY, boolean opposite)
      Initializes the starting Piece objects for the Player, consisting of 7 Point pieces, 2 Plus pieces, 2 Hourglass pieces, 2 Time pieces, and 1 Sun piece.
      Parameters:
      offsetX - x-coordinate offset
      offsetY - y-coordinate offset
      opposite - the orientation of the pieces, true if the pieces are flipped 180 degree

      Resets the player count of the Player.
